label: Letter from Sidney Jennings Legendre, September 23, 1945
description: Letter from Sidney Legendre to his wife, Gertrude Legendre, recounting the events of a terrible party they had attended, requesting that she not gossip about things she reads in his letters, and advising her on the business affairs of Medway Plantation. Sidney continues in his letter to discuss the business affairs of the dress shop he had purchased, lament inflation, and describe the work they are doing to the apartment house and dress shop. He also encourages her to go on vacation to Acapulco and to not spend too much on a flat in New York, New York as he will only be using it when he is in town on business.

September 23, 1945
Gertie, Dear,
I have your letters of September 9th.,15th.,
and 19th. In the one fo the 9th, you said that Roger
Cutler and others had told you that the islanders in the
villas were charming and that you were afraid that
I did not know the people that are really residents of the island.
Accordingly against my better judgement I accepted an invitation
from Clark Reynolds and his wife to a cook tail party and
buffet dinner. They were the ones that h d spent the winter
with xxxxxxx Laddie and Mary in Mexico playing polo. All the
villa people were there in force dressed in evening colothes for
thecocktail garty that began at five. Dillinghams, Baldwins etc.
I had not had anyting to drink for the past month and had no
ontention of drinking at this party but after an hour of standing
on one foot and then the other I gave in and had a drink, this
alone made me furious because I have been feeling so wonderful
that I just hated doing nyting that would in anyway take off the
edge. Things did not go so well. Some women c me up to me and
asked who did I think I was, that her brother had spoken to me
at the tennis club and I had just nodded. I should have told her
that I ddd not know who she was so how in the devil did I know
who her brother was. While this was going on I heard morris out
of one ear saying to Mrs Baldwin, you are absoluly wrong and
then he left her. After this little by play my hostess came up
and said that she thought that Morris was devine,that I was queer
She said thatshe had written this to Mary and Mary had writ ten
back asking what she meant by "queer". I asked her also
but she wandered off on some other subject between excahnging
kisses with various men. I was then introduced to a Mr
Dillingham who said he was sorry he could not get up to shake
hands but he was too drunk. After this Admiral Halsey
fastened himself on our necks about  n p rtment for some girls,
apparently we had not given them one when Pi gy Weeks had asked
us to. I didnt remember  nything  bout it and told himso, but
he kept ins sting we had played him foul . When we tried to go
home Lou the hostess fastened herself around Morris and said
he could not go, she had to just dance and dance with him.
I guess I  m all wrong but I think I will continuex to trim the
vines and work with the  p rtmmt house andthe business and wait
until you come out here and do the social life for me. I am
not very good at it.
The place isl velier than ever I live never seen such
still quiet sunny mornings when all the palm trees are glistening
and the Ala Wai sparkles and sends its little ripples washing
against the wal . We sit drinking our coffee on theporch
looking at the hills in the distanc e and say over and over
[End Page 1]
that there is not any place in the wo ld to match this island
or roup of islands for weather and be uty. Before going any
further let me warn you not to mention to anyone, Ellen included
what I have said about the people on this island. Things like
that fly like thewind andin a very few days someone will report
from the mainland to someone here or comming here that
Si dney Legendre thinks the islanders are terrible etc. The
result will be that when you arrive it ill be very difficult to
make friends. I really mean this warning and sk that you heed it
I am writing a letter to George again telling him
to get the necessary informati on . The ,ast time I didthis
he came back with an asnwer that it was not necessary. God
save me from those charlesonians when it comes to getting things
done. I think you have to go to Moncks corner for that.
Knoth understands the idea of our timbering and as we
will see the trees marked before we agree to the cutting I think
it will be alright. Naturally it will hurt the appearance of the
property in that you will se tree tops on the ground but I just
do not think in these times that this little insult to the
astetlc tastes can be spported.
Please tell Tat that her dresses have not arrivedas
yet and that we are waiting as anxiously as she for the day when
we may see them. There is a big wedding aking place in the
early part of October and if we only hadthosedresses then we would
make a killing. Everyone is comming in and asking us if we
kn w when they are comming in and to please let them know right
away etc.
Not only can I not get a blast out of Jo Jo but I cannot
get a letter out of her at all. However as she owes us less
than we one her it is OK with me. She is rea ly crazy I must
admit because she had nothing to gain by her extraordianry
behavi ur and a lot to lose.
As far as inflation is concerned I have b en hearing this
foryear . I remember when your father was s ti ll alive everyone
was yelling about inflation and sell all government bonds and
they still are crying wolf wolf and the bonds are higher than ever
There is not n attractive bathing suit in town and
we have sold practically all the ones that we bou ht in New York.
As I remember you askedme to bring you back a mans dressing gown
I c nnot find anything like theone that I have. They are terrlbie
now with the most dreadful colors you can imagine.
Certainly had a good laugh at your telephonecharge of
eighty bucks. I guess in the nature you hadbetter call me at
95121 because we might talk for an hour the next time and then
I would be too poor to get passage back home. It certainly
is worth any amount to talk to youand it all seems so natural
chatting away. Probablty after have been home for a
month you will neverwant to hear me again.
[End Page 2]
3
In answer to your question we have fif teen dresses made
up in the altman and McCutcheon material ard they are a great
success . The little Jap women is   wizz and could not make them
better. She is necessarllyllmited by the fact that she had
to gradually get rid of all her other costnrners to take us on
but now she has and thirgs will be going better. We make belts f
of the same materaila and also buttons coveredw ith the same materi
naturally it is not as smart but you cannot get the other things
out here as yet. I wrote to tat ard asked her to send me some
belts but she never answered my letter. If you see her tell her
to please let me have about a dozen or so belts just to see how
they go, t en if they are a success I will buy more.
My big laugh of the day c me when I sat down and read your
letter of the 19th. saying that  he apartment house would be
alldecorated and the shop finished by the time youcame out and
there would not be any more fu . For your infomation we have
bought two ash trays so far. Everything else has consi sted of
shifting rugs from one apartment to the other. Nailing c airs
together and trying to make ovens work. Morris is the electrical
and carpenter and I am the decorator protector ofcarpe ts and
punee covers, and inventorieer of shina and silver. I can only
tell you that there is plenty of wrk and no quitting when you are
tire . We have hadfour apartments b come empty in the past two
days and new people clamoring for them di rty or not. Everyone
wantsto move in before the beds are cool, andthe places are
so drty that I cant let than do it. Thismornigg I spent cleaning
an ice box andstove while Morris was repairing the electrical
connection. I dragged out the rugs and am sedning them to the cl
cleaners tomorrow with the curtains. Also the inven tory of
sivler, pots and pans, blankets ard bedspreads is in such a
mess because during the war days we never had time to count them
andadj st difference. Now it is hitting us at once with the
realization that we have to fin sh it before leaving and I can
tell you we are humping. In addition getting Gerrys books into
shape taking care of due rapidly increasing business etc. is
breath taking. When you come out youcan havefree rein to nuy
what you want [wi th your own money] you cant expect a poor
apartment house to be buying new things. Our apartment is
really shabby, but we aredoing nothing to it until you come out.
The cahirs have to be revocered t e curtains hang limp, the
dinning room rug is worn out and was taken down to the cellar
today. The pent house porch is shot to hell all the cus ions etc
have faded out completly and there isenough to keep you
busy for six years. Gerrys shop was furnished entirely with
aparment house lft over, we did not buy anything at all, so you
can see it could stand a little purchasingh re and there although
it looks very well if I say so my self. Blue walls, blue curtain
over the front of the closcet containg the clothers, Blue drapes
with perpendicular red stripes, and a red rugh on the floor.
Bamboo furniture with white xxxxxx cushions, very chic, but
should have a lahala [grass] mat on the floor, cool summery
curtains, but what can you expect a poor business to pay.
[End Page 3]
Encleed is a check from Gerry for the cloth that you bought.
She asks me to again thank youfor doing this and for your wonder
ful taste in picking out the models. They were p rfect and by
anf far the nicest and chicest things we havehad.
Acapulco sounds marvellous. If you are therewhen I return
I c n fly down from New York or perhaps straight from Frisco.
Hainving had a little ex ericne of p rtridge shooting In the far
west I have some doubtas about this especially since we will
get some shooting in the south. I think the sea and sunshine is
more our dish. When I find out what is going to happen to me
I can let you know my plans . In the meantime le t me knowyour
Mexian address in order that I can write you direct. The news
about xx isthis, my papers for release went in on the 20th.
They told me yesterday they were under severeal thousand other pa
papers, butof co urse everone was doing there best to get us out.
Wham this will happen is beyond re but I still gues around the be
ggining of Octo ber. Then I will try either to get on the plane 
or a ship and come on back.
Dont spend to much on the flat bec use all I want to do in
New York is business and certainly will not want to be in the ci
ty longer than is necessary. Anddont let that 80,000 burn a
hole in your pocket. You haveplenty of time to see theworldand
find the place we like. In the meantime you have a plntation in
Sohth carolina and a pent house and apa rtment building in
Honolulu , a house in Florida that is s rt of mixed up with
familly, two race horses and several chi dren some dogs, ROSE
and what more caould a marriedcouple ask for, except a big
bed and not to soft a one at that.
So long old timerour separation is almost over and we can
pick up where we left off [in bed wth a bottle of champa gne].
All my love darling until we meet again.
[End Page 4]
